thread.title: Smart jackets are cool. What about the rest of your ensemble?
thread.title_full: Smart jackets are cool. What about the rest of your ensemble?

author: USA TODAY
title: Smart jackets are cool. What about the rest of your ensemble?
text:
Smart jackets are cool. What about the rest of your ensemble? Brett Molina , USA TODAY 2:34 p.m. ET March 14, 2017 2 Shares 
USA TODAY's Marco della Cava tries on the new denim jacket from Google and Levi's. (Photo: Google) 
Forget about a smart jacket. What would you do with a smart wardrobe? 
During the SXSW Conference and Festivals, Google and Levi's showcased jacketA, a smart denim jacket that allows users to access their music or listen to directions . It's part of their joint Project Jacquard, aimed at weaving touch and gesture technology into everyday objects like clothes and furniture. 
But it's not just your jacket getting smarter. There are enough projects in the works where one person could pull together a complete smart outfit. 
Ridiculous? Yes. Expensive? Definitely. Weirdly cool? You bet. Facebook Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Stephen Sherring, of Australia, takes flight with Birdly, a VR flight simulation experience, during SXSW in Austin. Jarrad Henderson, USA TODAY A teardown of the inside of the Devialet Phantom Implosive Sound sits on display during SXSW. Jarrad Henderson, USA TODAY Guests pack the Japan House where "The Discussion With Robots" featured two robotic artificially intelligent conversationalist developed by Osaka University and NTT during SXSW. Jarrad Henderson, USA TODAY Sony shows off their Xperia Touch during SXSW. Jarrad Henderson, USA TODAY Lead engineer Gavin Barnes demos the Lockheed Martin Fortis exoskeleton during SXSW. Jarrad Henderson, USA TODAY The M3dPro, the first self-aware 3D printer sits on display during SXSW. Jarrad Henderson, USA TODAY A guest tries out Sony's mixed reality cave experience during SXSW. Jarrad Henderson, USA TODAY Kyuhee Lee shows off a pair of Cohesion LED glasses created by Funiot to Luciana Mendes and Ricardo Lima, both of Brazil, during SXSW. Jarrad Henderson, USA TODAY The 'exo-naked' robot is on display at Japan House during SXSW. Jarrad Henderson, USA TODAY Virginia Smirniotis, of Australia, checks out the Sony Xperia Touch during SXSW. Jarrad Henderson, USA TODAY Sony shows off their Xperia Touch during SXSW.
